page.title: 14WOODCUTTING IN FERNESS
page.content: Trees are cut down from between the ages of twenty to one hundred years old. different types of trees mature at different rates. The woodcutter identifies the trees to be felled by the paint spray marks which have been placed by the forester. A chain saw is used to cut down the trees, and the wood is taken out of the forest by means of a tractor and winch. It is then loaded on to lorries by a mechanical grab and transported to a sawmill. Once the wood is cut in the sawmill, it can then be used for building materials, fencing or in numerous other ways. Trees felled are very quickly replaced by new young ones in order that there will always be a steady supply in the future.
